page.title: 04JOHN CAIRNCROSS
page.content: John Cairncross has been an invalid,confined to a wheelchair,since 1951,when he broke his neck while playing rugby when a scrum collapsed. John has maintained his connection with the Jedforest Rugby Club ever since.He was Secretary for a large part of the 1960's and 1970's,and was Club President in 1981. In spite of being an invalid,John plays his part in the community,thanks mainly to his father for taking him around. Recently John was responsible for the start of an effort to raise Â£27,000 for a Heart Scanner for Peel Hospital,which is still the main hospital in the Borders,though Huntlyburn is well on the way.Â£23,000 has already been raised,several thousands of this in Jedburgh.
